title.rendered: Movistar Plus+ integrates the DAZN application in its UHD deco

content.rendered:
With this novelty, sports fans will be able to follow all their own content from Movistar Plus+ along with those offered by Movistar Plus+. DAZN: the Premier League, the MotoGP World Championship, the Turkish Airlines EuroLeague, the UEFA Women’s Champions League or exclusive Matchroom boxing evenings.

The alliance of DAZN and Movistar Plus+

Movistar Plus+ continues to be one of the benchmark integration platforms, by allowing the possibility of having LaLigaSports TV, ATRESplayer Premium, Mitele, Netflix, Disney+ and DAZN.

DAZN Movistar

With the latter, the relationship began in January 2021, when the channels DAZN F1, DAZN 1 and DAZN 2 were added to Movistar Plus+ to be able to broadcast different competitions that customers of the streaming sports platform could enjoy as part of their subscription. . Shortly after, there was an expansion phase, in which DAZN 3 and DAZN 4 arrived to expand the possibilities of broadcasting simultaneous events.

Later, Movistar Plus+ customers added the registration option and direct access to the DAZN app and to dazn.com. Now a new step forward is taken with the complete integration of its app in the UHD decoder so that customers with an active subscription to DAZN do not need to go out to see it in another way. From Movistar Plus+ itself, all its content can be accessed simply and directly, both live and on demand.

DAZN app on UHD deco

Starting today, Movistar Plus+ customers will be able to find the DAZN app in the main menu, near Netflix, Disney+ and others. It can also be accessed from the search engine or directly assigned to dial 103 of Movistar Plus+. If we directly access DAZN 1 (dial 59), DAZN 2 (dial 60), DAZN 3 (dial 177) or DAZN 4 (dial 178), a direct access to the app will be displayed. For Formula 1 lovers, DAZN F1 (dial 58) remains unchanged.

Deco UHD Movistar

The UHD decoder allows you to play the broadcast UHD/4K content on your TV. Remember that you must have contracted Fusion with fiber, or an equivalent miMovistar rate, and have included content packages to be able to view them.​

Movistar has started the process of renewing the HD decoders and expects all its customers to have the UHD set-top box by the end of 2023. The UHD decoder allows not only access to 4K content, but also improves the viewing experience and enjoyment of the content and incorporates all the new features of Movistar Plus+. Customers will receive an SMS or email to confirm the shipment of the new decoder. After confirmation, they will receive the equipment in 48-72 hours.
